questions.question: Which solution has the highest boiling point?

explanations.a: Higher molality and higher van 't Hoff factor (i = 3) for Ca(NO₃)₂ leads to the highest boiling point elevation.
explanations.b: Lower molality than option a, so lower boiling point elevation.
explanations.c: Lower van 't Hoff factor (i = 2) and molality compared to a and d.
explanations.d: Higher molality but lower van 't Hoff factor (i = 2) compared to option a.

questions.question: Which one of the following solvents has the lowest boiling point?

explanations.a: Carbon disulfide has the lowest boiling point among these solvents.
explanations.b: Carbon tetrachloride boils higher than carbon disulfide.
explanations.c: Chloroform boils higher than carbon disulfide.
explanations.d: Benzene has a higher boiling point than carbon disulfide.
